author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: daily-living, good-life-quotes, healthy-life, healthy-lifestyle, healthy-living

quote: when you disobey the rule, you sell your freedom. You cripple your real you. The daily direction of your life is restricted and directed by the rule and the ruling
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: caught-by-the-law, disobedience, freedom, freedom-of-choice, freedom-of-expression, freedom-of-speech, life, obeying-rules, reasons-why, rules, rules-and-regulations, rules-to-live-by, staying-focused

quote: Next time, mind the time! So many people waste their time as if they are so sure of the next time, but no one is all that very sure, with all certainty, of what is in next time! Next time, mind the time!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: next-time, time-management, time-passing, time-wasting

quote: Idleness never always means not doing anything at all, for everybody does something each moment of time! It is however also wasting our true, relevant and purposeful time on less purposeful things such that in the end, we only come to a remembrance of not just the true purposeful time we could have used, but also the true and real life we could have lived to leave distinctive footprints with the time we had!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: idleness-quote, staying-focused, time, time-management, time-wasting

quote: When you think about how time is passing, think about how you can use what is passing with time. You can't stop time but you can use or misuse what is passing with time
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: chances, love, opportunities-in-life, the-journey-of-life, time-management, time-passing, time-wasting, use-time

quote: The day time will stop moving, had I known and fulfillment will be the clock hands that will show many people the hour that passed and moment in which they are.
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: a-regretful-life, accountability-time, duty-and-attitude, famous-quotations, famous-quotes, famous-quotes-about-time, fulfilment, had-i-known, inspiring-wisdom, joy-quotes, life, loyalty-and-disloyalty, sorrow-quotes, time-management, time-wasted

quote: uncertainty is a path without an end. He who wants to completely do away with uncertainties before starting a purposeful journey of life shall always end a purposeful journey on the path of uncertainties without beginning any purposeful journey of life
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: a-great-footprint, a-journey-without-an-end, double-minded, doubting-mind, doubts, doubts-quotes, living-purposefully, purposeful-journey, the-journey-of-life, time-management, time-passing, timing, uncertainties, unending-path-of-life, waiting-to-start

quote: no one is absolutely free from the woes of life. Not even the one who thinks he is free from the uncertainties of life. Difficulties, challenges, problems and the puzzles of life are a must meet for all and sundry, be it small or enormous, and they are what separate the rich from the poor, the masters from the servants, the wonder from the wander and the givers from the beggars. Our ability to be firm and overcome the storms of life shall enlighten our light to make us different. In life, you either solve that problem or you always have that problem. People are uncommon because they overcome the common problems with common sense and tenacity. If you live your life without providing a panacea to a problem each day, ponder!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: challenging-life, common-sense, difficulties-in-life, free-from-troubles, knowing-you, life, life-issues, living-the-best-life, making-a-difference, no-one-is-free, overcoming-challenges, problems-of-life, problems-to-solve, staying-on-top, tenacity, time-management, understanding-life, why-are-people-different

quote: don't ever allocate necessary time for unnecessary things. Understand what time it is to do what it is
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: focusing, money-management, necessary-things, priorities, psyche, simplicity-in-life, time-allocations, time-management, time-management-quotes, understanding-time

quote: time and attention is just like the check, you do not just issue them to anything or anybody at all
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: best-thing, focused, focused-quote, life, purpose-driven-life, time, time-management

quote: Don’t conclude so fast, you may never know what is behind the fact you know!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: accusations, conclusion-before-evidence, facts, first-impressions, the-truth

quote: When you meet familiarity which demeans true integrity, run away!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: dignity, familiarity, humor, integrity, wisdom

quote: Familiarity increases carnality.
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: carnality, dignity, familiarity, gaining-respect, rules-of-life

quote: They that live at the source of a great river shall always take the great river for granted but they that live at the estuary of the great river shall always watch the great river in awe and admiration!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: close-friendship, dignity, dignity-quotes, familiarity, familiarity-and-attitude, lessons-of-life, love, respecting-others-dignity, taking-people-for-granted

quote: There should be an absolute discipline in the house of God
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: church-service, serving-god

quote: The book you read and read well, over and over again, lives in you, becomes your thought and thinking pattern, teaches you all the time and keeps reminding about how to act and react towards things and occurrences’ in life!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: reading-books, reading-quotes

quote: Books have immortalized great minds. Books have kept ancients secrets alive. A world which least value books, least value the real essence of wisdom and least know how to preserve what is precious!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: books, good-books, great-minds, life, philosophy, preserving-wisdom, reading-books, reading-for-life, religion-and-philoshophy, the-essence-of-time, world-book-day

quote: If your best friends do not read books, they reads you.
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: best-friends, companionship-quotes, reading, reading-books, understanding-people, what-matters, what-people-think-of-you, whatever

quote: If your best friends do not read books, they read you.
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: best-friends, companionship-quotes, reading, reading-books, understanding-people, what-matters, what-people-think-of-you, whatever

quote: when you read once, you get the understanding ; when you read twice, you get the second understanding. Don't just read, read!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: read-for-change, readers-and-writers, readers-life, reading, reading-a-second-time, reading-books, reading-habit, understanding-learning

quote: Keep calm when things don’t go according to your expectations! Beautiful things always meet friction!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: bad-day, challenges-of-life, challenging-times, confusion, despair-and-attitude, hurdles, obstacles, when-things-go-wrong

quote: When all things go bad, do not think so badly about all things, instead think about the things that made all things went bad and change something!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: confusion, difficult-times, optimistic, pessimism, stay-calm, think-positively

quote: Surprise is just a paradox. Sometimes it annoys us; sometimes it shakes the tears of joy within us; sometimes it makes us ponder; sometimes it ceases our words and leaves our jaws open, and sometimes, it shuts our lips; for a moment, surprises can put our minds into a state of confusion and halt the movement of the body. Watch out for surprises for surprises are there to surprise you!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: confusion, paradox-of-life, strange, surprises

quote: If the one who is to get us the news is in chains, the news may get to us but with chains!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: journalism, media-freedom, press-freedom

quote: Another great mistake is this; another understandable error is this: living to live the footprints of others when you have your own foot! Live your footprints! You were born unique! If possible, put the shoes of others, (they must fit you however) but don't walk as they walked and as much as possible, don't leave the same footprints they left except you were born to be like them or you can change the face of their footprints into a unique artifact!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: be-yourself, fake, footprints, imitation, originality

quote: So many teachers teach us but we shall always remember certain teachers
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: leadership-quotes, teaching-children, teaching-quotes, unforgettable-memory, unforgettable-teacher, words-of-the-teacher

quote: Go ahead and eat your bread, a time will come when it shall get to you breath. Go ahead and leave your pen, exams will come when you shall remember the pen!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: disobedience, doing-anything-anyhow, failure-quotes, forgetfulness, mistakes-quotes, time-wasting, vigilance, wasting-life, wasting-resources

quote: Everyday, you leave a footprint!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: daily-life, daily-steps, footprints, footprints-in-life, footprints-of-life, life

quote: God always smiles because of our little deeds done with a good heart, but to make the heart of God always beat for you, win and keep a soul for Him!
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: christian-quotes, christianity-faith, make-god-smile, the-work-of-god, win-a-soul

quote: Had I known only tells us the regretful stories of yesterday better
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: life, life-and-mistakes, memories-quotes, mistakes-quotes, pain-of-the-past, regrets, the-past

quote: If you least understand the essence of timely and courageously saying no to what you have to say no to, when you have to say no, you shall always say yes to what is due no remorsefully and count the cost of never saying no when you had to in pity though you shall know your ‘had I know’ in the end.
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: courage-quotes, courage-to-be-oneself, courage-to-say-no, had-i-know, knowing-what-you-want, learning-to-say-no, life-lessons, pity, regrets, remorse, staying-assertive, yes-and-no

quote: If you least understand the essence of timely and courageously saying no to what you have to say no to, when you have to say no, you shall always say yes to what is due no remorsefully and count the cost of never saying no when you had to in pity though shall know your had I know in the end.
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: courage-quotes, courage-to-be-oneself, courage-to-say-no, had-i-know, knowing-what-you-want, learning-to-say-no, life-lessons, pity, regrets, remorse, staying-assertive, yes-and-no

quote: when you really realize how you have lived your life, you indeed realize how you must live your life. It is mostly they that have least time to ponder always who always find time to wonder.
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: learning-from-adversity, learning-from-mistakes, learning-from-our-struggles, learning-life-lessons, lessons-in-life, lost-opprtunities, mistakes-quotes, ponder, reasons-to-be-happy, regrets, regrets-heartache, self-assessment

quote: When the minds of men slip from realities to fantasies without thinking of the future consequences, then we must ponder. When the hearts of men are entangled with what though might seem great but yet, specious ambitions without pondering over the resulting footprints, then we ought to take precautions. When the hands of men unwittingly and for the sake of self-gratification find the right weapons and dexterity for the wrong purpose, then massacre and cruelties leave indelible footprints of sorrow and bitterness in the hearts of men. We shall always look back to the footprints of yesterday to say had we know if we don’t take a critical look at today’s footsteps. There is always an alternative that is better than good
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: better-alternatives, changing-the-world, consequenses-of-the-past, fantasies, footprints-in-life, footprints-of-the-fathers, looking-back, massacres, motives, political-philosophy, political-science, political-tensions, regrets, self-gratifications, taking-precautions, why-war-comes, world-peace, world-war-1, world-war-two, wrong-motives

quote: if you will not always think about the decisions you are taking, you shall always think about the decisions you should have taken in regret, in wonder or in joy. Regrets of the past shall always remain an indelible footprint but the lessons from regrets can always be learned and be used
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: indelible-footprint, lessons-of-the-past, living-your-best-life, moving-forward, moving-on-and-letting-go, regrets, regrets-free-life, taking-a-decision, the-past, the-past-cannot-be-altered, tomorrow-today

quote: sing the song and let people do the interpretation. It is your duty to sing the unsung songs and it is their duty to do the interpretation
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah
category: be-assertive, be-who-you-are, challenges-quotes, count-and-be-counted, gossip, just-do-it, know-who-you-are, make-it-happen, purpose, stay-focused
